item.title: South Korea’s Acting President Han Duck-Soo Faces Impeachment Vote
item.description: The vote was the second major impeachment in two weeks after President Yoon’s ill-fated martial law bid set off turmoil. The country’s currency has pl...

item.title: Friday Briefing
item.description: A mysterious vessel in Finnish waters.

item.title: Two Sailors Die in Separate Incidents in Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race
item.description: The men were hit in the head by booms on their yachts in separate episodes, as participants faced challenging weather conditions, the police said.

item.title: Who Are the Houthis and Why Is the U.S. and Israel Attacking Them?
item.description: The Iranian-backed militia has launched attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea and against Israel.

item.title: Prosecutors in Taiwan Indict Ko Wen-je, Former Presidential Candidate
item.description: The prosecutors asserted that Ko Wen-je, a former mayor, took bribes. He and his supporters have maintained that the charges are a political vendetta.
